title: Sonatas and Partitas J.S. Bach by Yehudi Menuhin
description:
The Sonatas and Partitas for solo violin (BWV 1001Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1006) are a set of six works composed by Johann Sebastian Bach. They consist of three sonatas da chiesa, in four movements, and three partitas, in dance-form movements.

The set was completed by 1720, but was only published in 1802 by Nicolaus Simrock in Bonn. Even after publication, it was largely ignored until the celebrated violinist Josef Joachim started performing these works. Today, Bach's Sonatas and Partitas are an essential part of the violin repertoire, and they are frequently performed and recorded.

The Sei Solo Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a violino senza Basso accompagnato, as Bach titled them, firmly established the technical capability of the violin as a solo instrument.
